H0.text: Embryo is what develops and is nourished in vivipary.

H1.text: Vivipary refers to the development and nourishment of a seed.

H2.text: Eggs develop and are nourished in vivipary.

H3.text: Nucleus is the structure whose development and nourishment is referred to as vivipary.

A4.text: Vivipary occurs when seeds or embryos begin to develop before they detach from the parent.

A5.text: In some species of mangroves, the seed germinates and grows from its own resources while still attached to its parent.
